TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit XmlReflectionMember extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Provides mappings between code entities in .NET Framework Web service methods and the content of Web Services Description Language (WSDL) messages that are defined for SOAP Web services.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.XmlReflectionMember> class is not used directly. Instead, it is used:
- To initialize <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.XmlSerializer> objects while the .NET Framework is initializing a SOAP Web service or client.
- By the <xref:System.Web.Services.Description.ServiceDescriptionReflector> class while <xref:System.Web.Services.Description.ServiceDescriptionReflector> creates <xref:System.Web.Services.Description.ServiceDescription> objects from classes that are identified as SOAP Web services.
During reflection of a SOAP Web service method, arrays of <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.XmlReflectionMember> objects are produced that represent the contents of WSDL message definitions. An array is produced for each of the following items that belong to a SOAP Web service method:
- Input parameters.
- Output parameters and return values.
- Request SOAP headers via attributes.
- Response SOAP headers via attributes.
The <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.SoapReflectionImporter> and <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.XmlReflectionImporter> classes translate an <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.XmlReflectionMember> array into an <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.XmlMembersMapping> that contains an <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.XmlMemberMapping> collection, for further processing.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the represents a Web service method return value, as opposed to an output parameter.
Docs.value: , if the member represents a Web service return value; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks You do not need to use the <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.XmlReflectionMember> class and its properties directly.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the name of the Web service method member for this mapping.
Docs.value: The name of the Web service method.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The Web service method member may be an input parameter, an output parameter, a return type, an input header, or an output header.
You do not need to use the <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.XmlReflectionMember> class and its properties directly.
See the <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.XmlMembersMapping> class for the cases when a member corresponds to a `<part>` element defined in a Web Services Description Language (WSDL) document. Note, however, that with a wrapped binding between a WSDL operation and a .NET Framework method (indicated by the <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapParameterStyle.Wrapped> enumeration member), the method parameters and return value do not appear in the WSDL document.
When a Web service method is being reflected, the return type's <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.XmlReflectionMember.MemberName%2A> property becomes the method name (made unique from other member names, if necessary) with "Result" appended.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the type of the Web service method member code entity that is represented by this mapping.
Docs.value: The of the Web service method member code entity that is represented by this mapping.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The Web service method member's code entity may be an input parameter, an output parameter, a return type, or a SOAP header attribute.
You do not need to use the <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.XmlReflectionMember> class and its properties directly.
See the <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.XmlMembersMapping> class for the cases when a member corresponds to a part element defined in a Web Services Description Language (WSDL) document. Note, however, that with a wrapped binding between a WSDL operation and a .NET Framework method (indicated by the <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapParameterStyle.Wrapped> enumeration member), the method parameters and return value do not appear in the WSDL document.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates that the value of the corresponding XML element definition's isNullable attribute is .

remarks.format:
## Remarks This setting overrides the <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.XmlElementAttribute.IsNullable%2A> property of the <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.XmlElementAttribute> attribute. It is set to `true` only when a SOAP header's type is neither <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapHeader> nor <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapUnknownHeader>.
You do not need to use the <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.XmlReflectionMember> class and its properties directly.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a with the collection of SOAP-related attributes that have been applied to the member code entity.
Docs.value: A that contains the objects that represent SOAP attributes applied to the member.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The Web service method member's code entity may be an input parameter, an output parameter, a return type, an input SOAP header attribute, or an output SOAP header attribute.
You do not need to use the <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.XmlReflectionMember> class and its properties directly.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets an with the collection of -related attributes that have been applied to the member code entity.
Docs.value: An that represents XML attributes that have been applied to the member code.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The Web service method member's code entity may be an input parameter, an output parameter, a return type, an input SOAP header attribute, or an output SOAP header attribute.
You do not need to use the <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.XmlReflectionMember> class and its properties directly.
